problem_text:
Let p be a prime. The law x · xφ · · · xφp−1 = 1 from the definition of a splitting automorphism (see Archive, 1.10) gives rise to a variety of groups with operators ⟨φ⟩ consisting of all groups that admit a splitting automorphism of order p. Does the analogue of Kostrikin’s theorem hold for this variety, that is, do the locally nilpotent groups in this variety form a subvariety?

E. I. Khukhro
answer: Yes, it does (E. I. Khukhro, Math. USSR–Sb., 58 (1987), 119–126).
